str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: From kata and lambano; to take eagerly, i.e. Seize, possess, etc.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
